page.title: 16 THORPE ARCH continued
page.content:
Many of the traders specialise in one product often of a specialist nature, like the cycle manufacturer of tandem light weight cycle frames and the toys and games manufacturers that concentrate on making hand painted 'Smurfs'.
One of the biggest storage wharehouses on Thorp Arch is called Moore's Furniture Group. The land was bought after the war by George Moore who started the Trading Estate.
Some of the larger factories provide buses or mini buses, for their workers as there is no public transport. Most of Thorpe Arch employees travel by car from the surrounding villages. Most employees live within seven miles vicinity.
